results.title: No pain, no mess
results.creator_credit: Simon Target and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Academy”.
Six weeks into their training and its getting tough for some. Laura is having problems sleeping and trying to survive on four hours sleep a night. The cadets are coming up to their first parade and also their first visit with friends and family since joining ADFA. The third year cadets are on a tour of Gallipoli where they come to terms with the reality of war and loss of life, they also participate in the annual soccer match against Turkey; a match Australia has never won.

results.title: The Adventures of the Lone Ranger: more than magic
results.creator_credit: Earl Bellamy, Sherman A. Harris, Jack Wrather Productions and Palan Entertainment
results.brief_description: A compilation of three episodes from the classic cult television serial of the 1950s, “The Lone Ranger” starring Clayton Moore as the Lone Ranger and Jay Silverheels as his faithful Indian companion Tonto. For those who remember, and can never forget the famous cry of “Hi yo Silver, away” and the sound of The Lone Ranger theme, the William Tell Overture, this video will take you back to a time when good always overcame evil, and a masked hero riding a stallion called Silver and his Indian companion would save us from the perils of the marauding outlaws and bandits of the West - a time of old-fashioned good guy, bad guy. “Outlaws in greasepaint”: DeWitt and Lavinia Faversham are two out-of-work actors who turn their acting skills and the art of disguise to the more lucrative business of robbing the Wells Fargo gold shipments. The Lone Ranger, not to be outdone, becomes a master of disguise to outwit these two bandits. “Hotspell in Panamint”: A plot by Big Joe Hunsaker and his band of outlaws to gun down Marshall Roy Bell of Panamint in order to steal a gold shipment is foiled by The Lone Ranger with the help of Miss Sarah Edwards and her small hand mirror. “White Hawk’s decision”: Rivalry between two young Indian brothers, Little Hawk and Fleet Horse for the honour of succeeding their father White Hawk as Chief takes a nasty turn. The Lone Ranger and Tonto step in to help White Hawk in determining the future of his tribe. NOTE: The titles of each episode do not appear and each episode blends into the next without a definitive break.

results.title: Everyone's full bottle now
results.creator_credit: Simon Target and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Academy”.
The Academy looks at life as a new cadet at ADFA - the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. “Full bottle now” introduces Ilana Napier, a new cadet who leaves her family and home to spend three years training at ADFA and the struggles and challenges she experiences. This is also an important time at ADFA because they are undertaking a new experiment with training whereby new cadets will be trained by staff instead of by third year cadets. Kizzy Hyde shares her experiences and takes the viewer on a tour of the barracks as a third year cadet.

results.title: Killing ground
results.creator_credit: Simon Target and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Academy”.
The Killing ground looks at the physical and moral challenges in training the cadets. The cadets are starting to come to terms with the reality of the fitness training they are undertaking, training which comes before any academic study. This episode also focuses on how the female cadets are adjusting to a predominately male facility. Two girls, terrified of heights, are put to the test on an exercise to bring them to face to face with their fear. Kizzy reveals that because she has injured her foot in training and has no arch left in her left foot she may not be able to graduate. After spending three years at the academy - she may be discharged as physically unfit.

results.title: Bedtimes over
results.creator_credit: Simon Target and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Academy”.
Bedtime’s over: the second year cadets get a chance to put their training to the test when they are sent out on exercise to Puckapunyal, to go over the area and determine whether anyone they may come across is Militia or friend. The Navy cadets board HMAS Tobruk for their first trip and we are privy to their experience of what life is really like at sea and how it differs from their expectations.

results.title: The Adventures of Spot (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This collection of seven stories is based on the book by Eric Hill, featuring Spot - a young puppy, Sally and Sam his mother and father, and several of his friends. The films deal in a simple and entertaining way with the everyday happenings familiar to children the world over. 1. Sweet Dreams, Spot! 2. Spot Goes to School 3. Spot Goes to the Circus 4. Spot Follows his Nose 5. Spot Goes Splash 6. Spot’s Windy Day 7. Spot Goes on Holiday

results.title: The Admittance
results.creator_credit: Patricia Watson, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Jan, an intelligent 32 year old, separated from her husband, has suffered a nervous breakdown and tried to commit suicide. She is not helped by a cliche-ridden mother, but a sympathetic and affectionate bond exists with her sister, Barb. After repeated attempts, Barb finally succeeds in having Jan admitted to a psychiatric hospital for treatment. The film deals with the issues of self-doubt and failure, the structure of the human personality and the whole area of family relationships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Watson, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Adventures of Skippy. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Peter Andrikidis, Michael Midlam, Festival Records and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: Skippy, the famous bush kangaroo, joins with her friends in the National Park for three exciting adventures. In “Skippy and the vandals”, Jerry is accused of vandalising the local school. With the help of Skippy, the vandals are soon caught. In “Skippy and the beach bullies”, Jerry, Lou and Skippy are enjoying the beach. However, two bullies are intent on spoiling their fun and getting Skippy into trouble with the Police. The final episode entitled “Skippy and the balloon” has a young Japanese tourist aloft in a balloon over the park because he doesn’t want to go home!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Andrikidis, Michael Midlam, Festival Records and Nine Network (Australia)

results.title: The 12 steps: recovering from addictions. - Steps One to Eight.
results.creator_credit: Jim Hanley, Kaleidoscope Entertainment, Manitoba TV and Sleeping Giant Productions
results.brief_description: Throughout the 13 episodes, 12 characters are constantly entwined. Their experiences of the Alcoholics Anonymous 12 step program, compellingly told and captured first hand are interspersed with expert opinion for structural cohesiveness and direction. Step 1: “We admitted we were powerless over our addiction - that our lives had become unmanageable.” 2. “Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity”. 3. “Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood him.”. 4. “Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.” 5. “Admitted to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.” 6. “Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.” 7. “Humbly asked him to remove our shortcomings.” 8. “Made a list of all persons we had harmed and became willing to make amends to them all.” Narrated by John Vernon.
results.title_for_label: The 12 steps: recovering from addictions. - Steps One to Eight.
